column4: I've been having trouble getting my bootloader to appear when restarting, so I'm reinstalling Ubuntu.  I'm on this step http://imagebin/204701 and I'm not sure which device to choose for boot loader installation
put the boot loader on the boot disk - nothing else
keep your setup simple, the boot loader goes on the mbr of the boot disk, and the boot loader goes in the /boot partition
your grub is pointing at a partition that doesn't exist
How should I proceed?  Not sure what to do on this black screen..
what's happened to your install to cause this ?
grub should go on a device not a partition, so /dev/sda (or /dev/sdb (what ever your device is is )) is the correct approach
Well, that's what I did and when I restarted I was presented with a black screen stating, "error: no such partition."
how many disks to you have ?
so two hard disks in your machine ?
please just answer the question
that's what Disk Utility told me..
no - I'm asking you
how many hard disk are in the machine - not what you think, what disk utility tells, how many factual physical hard disks are in the machine
it might have just been the RAM i was looking at..
I'm sure someone else will help you,
